trans-unit.source: layout: page title: "Dive Into Rust" permalink: /rust-hack/ lang: en ref: rust-hack parent: activities
trans-unit.target: layout: page title: "Dive Into Rust" permalink: /rust-hack/ lang: ar ref: rust-hack parent: activities

trans-unit.source: redirect_from: "/developer-engagement/rust-hack/"
trans-unit.target: redirect_from: "/developer-engagement/rust-hack/"

trans-unit.source: TOC
trans-unit.target: TOC

trans-unit.source: {:toc}
trans-unit.target: {:toc}

trans-unit.source: Rust is a systems programming language that runs blazingly fast, prevents segfaults, and guarantees thread safety.
trans-unit.target: Rust is a systems programming language that runs blazingly fast, prevents segfaults, and guarantees thread safety.

trans-unit.source: [Find out more...](https://www.rust-lang.org)
trans-unit.target: [Find out more...](https://www.rust-lang.org)

trans-unit.source: Impact and Metrics
trans-unit.target: Impact and Metrics

trans-unit.source: The Rust programming language will be important to the future of the web, making it safe and great.
trans-unit.target: The Rust programming language will be important to the future of the web, making it safe and great.

trans-unit.source: Having more developers understand, use and evangelize this language will advance make the web better and more secure.
trans-unit.target: Having more developers understand, use and evangelize this language will advance make the web better and more secure.

trans-unit.source: Rust will also be used extensively for Mozilla projects -- including this year as Servo (written in Rust) is advanced even further, and parts of it are moved into Gecko/Firefox.
trans-unit.target: Rust will also be used extensively for Mozilla projects -- including this year as Servo (written in Rust) is advanced even further, and parts of it are moved into Gecko/Firefox.

trans-unit.source: Having more Mozilla contributors know Rust will give them a chance to contribute to the most exciting and important technical projects coming up for Mozilla.
trans-unit.target: Having more Mozilla contributors know Rust will give them a chance to contribute to the most exciting and important technical projects coming up for Mozilla.

trans-unit.source: Goals for this area
trans-unit.target: Goals for this area

trans-unit.source: __Impact:__
trans-unit.target: __Impact:__

trans-unit.source: 1,000 programmers/developers are introduced to and are well on their way to learning Rust
trans-unit.target: 1,000 programmers/developers are introduced to and are well on their way to learning Rust

trans-unit.source: 10 blog posts about events or other local Rust activities
trans-unit.target: 10 blog posts about events or other local Rust activities

trans-unit.source: __Strength:__
trans-unit.target: __Strength:__

trans-unit.source: 50 Mozillians organize Rust Hack and Learn events
trans-unit.target: 50 Mozillians organize Rust Hack and Learn events

trans-unit.source: 50 new people signed up to [Rust developer list](https://users.rust-lang.org)
trans-unit.target: 50 new people signed up to [Rust developer list](https://users.rust-lang.org)

trans-unit.source: Audience for this activity
trans-unit.target: Audience for this activity

trans-unit.source: Your audience for this event should be **programmers and developers**.
trans-unit.target: Your audience for this event should be **programmers and developers**.

trans-unit.source: Focus on people who are technical and already know languages like C or Python or other similar languages.
trans-unit.target: Focus on people who are technical and already know languages like C or Python or other similar languages.

trans-unit.source: Activity Format
trans-unit.target: Activity Format

trans-unit.source: Get your community behind this exciting new programming language by running a learning event.
trans-unit.target: Get your community behind this exciting new programming language by running a learning event.

trans-unit.source: Put an event team together
trans-unit.target: Put an event team together

trans-unit.source: Choose a date and secure a venue
trans-unit.target: Choose a date and secure a venue

trans-unit.source: Choose whether this will be self-facilitated or with someone who has Rust experience (see below)
trans-unit.target: Choose whether this will be self-facilitated or with someone who has Rust experience (see below)

trans-unit.source: Setup the event on Reps Portal ([instructions](https://wiki.mozilla.org/ReMo/SOPs/Event_hosting))
trans-unit.target: Setup the event on Reps Portal ([instructions](https://wiki.mozilla.org/ReMo/SOPs/Event_hosting))

trans-unit.source: For duration, we recommend a half-day (or full evening) event with a minimum of 15-25 attendees.
trans-unit.target: For duration, we recommend a half-day (or full evening) event with a minimum of 15-25 attendees.

trans-unit.source: There are two options for facilitation:
trans-unit.target: There are two options for facilitation:

trans-unit.source: Ask a person with experience with Rust to attend and provide guidance to attendees.
trans-unit.target: Ask a person with experience with Rust to attend and provide guidance to attendees.

trans-unit.source: There are a few ways to try to find local Rust experts to invite:
trans-unit.target: There are a few ways to try to find local Rust experts to invite:

trans-unit.source: Reach out to the [Community Team](https://www.rust-lang.org/en-US/team.html#Community-team) - community-team [at] rust-lang [dot] org - they know the most active people in most regions.
trans-unit.target: Reach out to the [Community Team](https://www.rust-lang.org/en-US/team.html#Community-team) - community-team [at] rust-lang [dot] org - they know the most active people in most regions.

trans-unit.source: Via the [user groups](https://www.rust-lang.org/en-US/user-groups.html)
trans-unit.target: Via the [user groups](https://www.rust-lang.org/en-US/user-groups.html)

trans-unit.source: At [rustaceans.org](http://www.rustaceans.org/)
trans-unit.target: At [rustaceans.org](http://www.rustaceans.org/)

trans-unit.source: If the facilitators have little or no Rust experience, turn it into a learning session for everyone, where you go through the steps together.
trans-unit.target: If the facilitators have little or no Rust experience, turn it into a learning session for everyone, where you go through the steps together.

trans-unit.source: Some Mozillians have already done such sessions.
trans-unit.target: Some Mozillians have already done such sessions.

trans-unit.source: For example our [Community Spaces](https://wiki.mozilla.org/Participation/Community_Spaces) have, so you can reach out the them to ask for some guidance.
trans-unit.target: For example our [Community Spaces](https://wiki.mozilla.org/Participation/Community_Spaces) have, so you can reach out the them to ask for some guidance.

trans-unit.source: Event Flow
trans-unit.target: Event Flow

trans-unit.source: Install Rust
trans-unit.target: Install Rust

trans-unit.source: [rustup](https://www.rustup.rs) - recommended
trans-unit.target: [rustup](https://www.rustup.rs) - recommended

trans-unit.source: [Rust downloads](https://www.rust-lang.org/downloads.html) (alternative)
trans-unit.target: [Rust downloads](https://www.rust-lang.org/downloads.html) (alternative)

trans-unit.source: Read the [Rust book](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/book/)
trans-unit.target: Read the [Rust book](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/book/)

trans-unit.source: Complete the [Rustlings](https://github.com/carols10cents/rustlings) (a great beginners course!)
trans-unit.target: Complete the [Rustlings](https://github.com/carols10cents/rustlings) (a great beginners course!)

trans-unit.source: Some projects with great first bugs:
trans-unit.target: Some projects with great first bugs:

trans-unit.source: The Rust language and compiler
trans-unit.target: The Rust language and compiler

trans-unit.source: [Labeled easy](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AE-easy)
trans-unit.target: [Labeled easy](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AE-easy)

trans-unit.source: [Labeled mentor](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AE-mentor)
trans-unit.target: [Labeled mentor](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AE-mentor)

trans-unit.source: [clippy - the popular Rust static analysis tool](https://github.com/Manishearth/rust-clippy)
trans-unit.target: [clippy - the popular Rust static analysis tool](https://github.com/Manishearth/rust-clippy)

trans-unit.source: [Cargo - Rust’s package manager](https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AE-easy)
trans-unit.target: [Cargo - Rust’s package manager](https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AE-easy)

trans-unit.source: [rustfmt - the Rust source code formatting tool](https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/rustfmt/issues)
trans-unit.target: [rustfmt - the Rust source code formatting tool](https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/rustfmt/issues)

trans-unit.source: Though some are without clear instructions, the domain is easy to understand (it's mostly manipulating strings), and potentially engaging.
trans-unit.target: Though some are without clear instructions, the domain is easy to understand (it's mostly manipulating strings), and potentially engaging.

trans-unit.source: [rustup - the Rust installer](https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/rustup.rs/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22help+wanted%22)
trans-unit.target: [rustup - the Rust installer](https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/rustup.rs/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22help+wanted%22)

trans-unit.source: Rust documentation
trans-unit.target: Rust documentation

trans-unit.source: [Labeled easy](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AA-docs+label%3AE-easy)
trans-unit.target: [Labeled easy](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AA-docs+label%3AE-easy)

trans-unit.source: [Standard library API docs](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/29329)
trans-unit.target: [Standard library API docs](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/29329)

trans-unit.source: [This Week in Rust](https://this-week-in-rust.org/) also publishes a call for participation each week with hot contribution ideas.
trans-unit.target: [This Week in Rust](https://this-week-in-rust.org/) also publishes a call for participation each week with hot contribution ideas.

trans-unit.source: Other Resources
trans-unit.target: Other Resources

trans-unit.source: Tutorials
trans-unit.target: Tutorials

trans-unit.source: [Niko Matsakis's excellent slide deck](https://github.com/nikomatsakis/rust-tutorials-keynote)
trans-unit.target: [Niko Matsakis's excellent slide deck](https://github.com/nikomatsakis/rust-tutorials-keynote)

trans-unit.source: [Exercises to accompany that deck](https://github.com/nikomatsakis/rust-tutorializer)
trans-unit.target: [Exercises to accompany that deck](https://github.com/nikomatsakis/rust-tutorializer)

trans-unit.source: [A screencast from Niko on ownership and borrowing](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TCUBSbJENO4)
trans-unit.target: [A screencast from Niko on ownership and borrowing](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TCUBSbJENO4)

trans-unit.source: Output
trans-unit.target: Output

trans-unit.source: Additional to the recommended event flow here are some things we’d like you, the event organizer, to do.
trans-unit.target: Additional to the recommended event flow here are some things we’d like you, the event organizer, to do.

trans-unit.source: Fill out the post-event metrics on the event page you setup on the Reps portal
trans-unit.target: Fill out the post-event metrics on the event page you setup on the Reps portal

trans-unit.source: Optionally, tell us about your event.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, tell us about your event.

trans-unit.source: This can be before or after.
trans-unit.target: This can be before or after.

trans-unit.source: We love to hear about upcoming plans, and of course love to hear about what was achieved at the event with a picture or two!
trans-unit.target: We love to hear about upcoming plans, and of course love to hear about what was achieved at the event with a picture or two!

trans-unit.source: This will also be instructional and inspirational to others who might do the event.
trans-unit.target: This will also be instructional and inspirational to others who might do the event.

trans-unit.source: [Here is the Discourse post to write to](https://discourse.mozilla-community.org/t/activate-mozilla-dive-into-rust/10073/1)
trans-unit.target: [Here is the Discourse post to write to](https://discourse.mozilla-community.org/t/activate-mozilla-dive-into-rust/10073/1)

trans-unit.source: Extra
trans-unit.target: Extra

trans-unit.source: While the focus of this activity should be on these events, there are other ways to stay more involved with the Rust community after.
trans-unit.target: While the focus of this activity should be on these events, there are other ways to stay more involved with the Rust community after.

trans-unit.source: Follow up with attendees to highlight [more things happening in the community to get involved with](https://www.rust-lang.org/en-US/community.html)
trans-unit.target: Follow up with attendees to highlight [more things happening in the community to get involved with](https://www.rust-lang.org/en-US/community.html)
